bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: $ /usr/bin/fedora-arm-image-installer --supported-boards cat: /SUPPORTED-BOARDS: No such file or directory
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): fedora-arm-installer-1.99.14-1.fc26.noarch
How reproducible: each time
Steps to Reproduce: 1. type the command 2. 3.
Actual results: a error message
Expected results: the list of board
Additional info: I suspect the problem is the lack of definition for $DOC_DIR
--supported-boards) cat $DOC_DIR/SUPPORTED-BOARDS
it should just be BOARD_DIR.
fedora-arm-installer-1.99.15-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-095b1c25ae
fedora-arm-installer-1.99.15-1.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-1e3fe3a174
fedora-arm-installer-1.99.15-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-2e6a0c3267
fedora-arm-installer-1.99.15-1.fc25 is also broken but it will be fixed next build.

fedora-arm-installer-1.99.15-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates.
